official_title: To amend section 201(e) of the Agricultural Act of 1949 to prohibit the sale, during a 3-year period, of milk produced by cows injected with bovine growth hormone, and to require that the Secretary of Agriculture issue rules requiring records to be kept by producers regarding the manufacture and sale of bovine growth hormone during such period, and for other purposes.
short_title: Bovine Growth Hormone Moratorium Act of 1990

summary.text: Bovine Growth Hormone Moratorium Act of 1990 - Amends the Agricultural Act of 1949 to prohibit the sale of milk produced by cows injected with bovine growth hormone. Requires a person who sells or injects bovine growth hormone to maintain records as determined by the Secretary of Agriculture. Establishes civil penalties for violations of this Act. Directs the Secretary to carry out a bovine growth hormone study.

titles.title: Bovine Growth Hormone Moratorium Act of 1990

To amend section 201(e) of the Agricultural Act of 1949 to prohibit the sale, during a 3-year period, of milk produced by cows injected with bovine growth hormone, and to require that the Secretary of Agriculture issue rules requiring records to be kept by producers regarding the manufacture and sale of bovine growth hormone during such period, and for other purposes.
